### PEO polymers in water

### PSS and PDADMA polyelectrolytes
<hr>

(provided by Jens Smiatek, [smiatek@icp.uni-stuttgart.de](mailto: smiatek@icp.uni-stuttgart.de))

Parameter files for PSS, poly(styrene sulfonate), and PDADMA, poly(diallyldimethylammonium), with 30 monomers. Also includes the Martini 2.2P parameter file including polystyrene beads (martini_v2.2P_PS.itp)

- [parameters-polyelectrolytes.tar.gz](https://martini-library.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/example_applications/polymers/parameters-polyelectrolytes.tar)

An example application to simulate an equilibrated PSS/PDADMA mixture including ions and water with all necessary parameter files.

- [example-polyelectrolyte-mixture.tar.gz](https://martini-library.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/example_applications/polymers/example-polyelectrolyte-mixture.tar)

Furthermore, a free program to generate topology files for arbitrarily long PSS or PDADMA chains can be found at:
[https://github.com/martinvoegele/martini-polyelectrolytes](https://github.com/martinvoegele/martini-polyelectrolytes)

The corresponding article can be cited as:

- Coarse-grained simulations of polyelectrolyte complexes: MARTINI models for poly(styrene sulfonate) and poly(diallyldimethylammonium). **VÃ¶gele, Martin and Holm, Christian and Smiatek, Jens.** The Journal of Chemical Physics, 143, 243151 (2015), DOI:[http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.4937805](http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.4937805)
